nodes.bodyText: @TobiGr The problem that arises when there "is any room for confusion" is sometimes you will have specifically "web-browser" as a translation, and other times you end up with specifically "file-browser". Thus removing the desired(?) ambiguity in languages that don't have it.

nodes.bodyText:
@TobiGr I think those are available as top level (Weblate) admins to do (on Hosted), so only for self-hosted instances. There is "review" access, but I don't think there are any more rights attached to it. I got admin access for the ones in https://hosted.weblate.org/user/kingu/#managed Won't touch anything without approval first :)
Can get the setup working a bit better some time later, right now there isn't fastlane support and a few other things could be better.

nodes.bodyText:
@opusforlife2
If you look at what the categories are in "Settings" for Android, it will say "and", not "&", between shared categories. Much like it says "and" for mentioning anything above one thing in NewPipe already.
If needing to specifically make it two distinct things,
"Option1, option 2" instead of
"Option1 option 2" is the way to go.
It makes it into languages where it doesn't belong at all
https://hosted.weblate.org/translate/newpipe/strings/nb_NO/?checksum=35c864b620356a41 https://hosted.weblate.org/translate/newpipe/strings/nb_NO/?checksum=b402d2ded65c5cd6 https://hosted.weblate.org/translate/newpipe/strings/nb_NO/?checksum=8260572532e87eb2
